brews.name: When Hoppy Met Roasty
brews.description: A dark IPA with a soft roast profile followed closely by bold, earthy hops. Will please Stout lovers and IPA aficionados alike.

brews.name: Her Majesty’s ESB
brews.description: Cooper Mountain Ale Works' special ESB is big on character. Toffee, raisin, and bread flavors from the malt balance perfectly with earthy British hops. A fruity yeast note rounds out this traditional style ale. Brilliant!

brews.name: Tripel Trouble, y’all
brews.description: This spicy Belgian ale spends several months cold conditioning to let the flavors meld, but it's worth waiting for. Star anise, orange peel, and coriander are used to add layers of flavor and aroma to this beer. Speaking of extra time, this beer spends 50% longer in the brew kettle to bring out more caramel notes and enhance this beer's natural color.

brews.name: Barrely, barrely, life is but a dream
brews.style: Bourbon barrel aged Imperial Strong Ale
brews.description: Scaling up our English Strong Ale recipe to 9% was no picnic, but the extensive floor mopping was eventually worth it after a few months in a fantastically wet Buffalo Trace bourbon barrel. Typical oak and vanilla notes blend smoothly into our robust malt profile, finishing with what seems to be a hint of coconut. The magical esters strike again!

brews.name: Deep Space Mountain
brews.description: In collaboration with Deep Space Brewing, we crafted this recipe with a bold red wine barrel finish in our minds from the outset. The cranberries, malts, and even the hops were chosen to blend perfectly into a well rounded Imperial Stout that would hold up to the barrel character as it aged. Waiting patiently (not our strong suit), we emptied the barrel just as it reached perfection.

brews.name: Stout Scout Stout
brews.description: This chocolate ale is full of flavor without being too strong. Flaked barley and wheat make this stout incredibly smooth—it'll keep you coming back for more. Dark enough to enjoy on a cold day, but light enough to enjoy in either of Oregon's two seasons.
